meanings.definition: To recover health and strength after illness or injury.
meanings.sent1: After being sick, I need to convalesce at home to get better.
meanings.sent2: She will convalesce in the hospital before returning to work.
meanings.sent3: The doctor advised him to convalesce for a few days, so he binge-watched his favorite TV shows.
meanings.sent4: Like a caterpillar in a cocoon, she needed to convalesce before emerging stronger than before.
meanings.sent5: Her body's ability to convalesce amazed everyone as she quickly regained her energy.

meanings.definition: The process of recovering health and strength after illness or injury.
meanings.sent1: His convalesce was slow but steady, and he eventually fully recovered.
meanings.sent2: The convalesce of the patient was closely monitored by the medical team.
meanings.sent3: The convalesce of the injured athlete became the talk of the town.
meanings.sent4: The convalesce of the economy after the crisis was a long and challenging process.
meanings.sent5: The convalesce of the garden after the harsh winter brought forth vibrant blooms in spring.
